result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy G Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court imposed the following sentence:  

Count 3, 6 months county jail straight time consecutive and consecutive to any other sentence
Count 4, 6 months county jail with huber privileges consecutive and consecutive to any other sentence. Court gives 35 days credit as to count 4. 
Court wiaves any costs. 
Restitution to the victim - FIA Card Services  in the amountof $318.12 and have this matter turn into a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing hearing on June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have come to an agreement.  State does not have an Amended Information prepared.  Counts 3 and 4 to be amended to misdemeanor Theft (as Party to the Crime) without the repeater.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 3 and 4,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 5 dismissed and read in.  Parties request adjourned sentencing date.  State to file Amended Information by end of business day on May 26, 2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Amy C Scholz.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Witnesses are sequestered for hearing. Officer Bradley Meyer, Town of Broofield Police Department, sworn and testified. Detective Sean Schmidt, Town of Brookfield Police Department, sworn and testified. Officer Sandra Brown, Village of Elm Grove Police Department, sworn and testified. Detective Craig Mayer, Elm Grove Police Department, sworn and testified.  State moves for bindover and presents argument to the court. Attorney Scholz moves for dismissal of all counts.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court hears defense bail motion. Attorney Scholz presents bail argument. State objects to modification of bail. Court denies motion to modify bail for reasons stated on the record.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
